conclusion: Analyzing liquid flow from points A, B, and C through baffles to containers D or E.
Image shows colored baffles on gray background, liquid release points A, B, C at top, containers D, E at bottom.
Second image shows actual liquid flow paths with dripping liquid.
Liquid starts at point A, encounters light blue/mint angled baffle directing it downward and right.
Liquid from A hits orange/yellow baffle, directing it further right.
Liquid from A continues downward and rightward due to gravity.
Second image shows white/light colored liquid from A flows down to left side above D.
Liquid starts at point B, hits black angled baffle directing it downward and right.
Liquid from B continues downward and may interact with other baffles.
Second image shows orange liquid from B flows toward right side.
Liquid from B flows toward container E.
Liquid starts at point C, green/light green liquid flows straight down.
Direct downward path of liquid from C takes it toward right side of setup.
Liquid from C reaches area above container E.
Liquid from point A flows into container D.
Liquid from point B flows into container E.
Liquid from point C flows into container E.
